00001 ///@file Battery.c
00002 ///@brief Backup battery management
00003 
00004 #include "TCPIP Stack/TCPIP.h"
00005 
00006 #include "SecuritySystem.h"
00007 #include "xPL.h"
00008 
00009 #define ADC_Battery 1   ///< ADC port for the battey voltage sensor
00010 #define ADC_Supply 2    ///< ADC port for the supply voltage sensor
00011 
00012 
00013  //******************************************************************************
00014  /** D E C L A R A T I O N S **************************************************/
00015  //******************************************************************************
00016 
00017 /// Text used for the current state of the alarm
00018 ROM char *BatteryStatesText[] =
00019         {
00020                 "Disconnected",
00021                 "Charging",
00022                 "Fully charged",
00023                 "In use"
00024         };
00025 
00026 BatteryStates BatteryState;             ///< Keeps track of the battery state
00027 unsigned int VoltageBattery;    ///< Battery voltage
00028 unsigned int VoltageSupply;     ///< 12v supply voltage

00038 //******************************************************************************
00039 /// Prints the supply voltage variable, not real time
00040 void HTTPPrint_VoltageSupply(void) {
00041         char Tempdigits[8];
00042 
00043         uitoa(VoltageSupply,  Tempdigits);
00044         TCPPutArray(sktHTTP, Tempdigits, strlen((char*)Tempdigits));
00045         return;
00046 }
00047 
00048 //******************************************************************************
00049 /// Prints the battery voltage variable, not real time
00050 void HTTPPrint_VoltageBattery(void) {
00051         char Tempdigits[8];
00052 
00053         uitoa(VoltageBattery,  Tempdigits);
00054         TCPPutArray(sktHTTP, Tempdigits, strlen((char*)Tempdigits));
00055         return;
00056 }
00057 
00058 //******************************************************************************
00059 /// Prints the battery status state, not real time
00060 void HTTPPrint_BatteryStatus(void) {
00061         if(TCPIsPutReady(sktHTTP) < strlenpgm((ROM char*) BatteryStatesText[BatteryState])) {
00062                 curHTTP.callbackPos = 0x01;
00063                 return;
00064         }
00065 
00066         TCPPutROMArray(sktHTTP, BatteryStatesText[BatteryState], strlenpgm((ROM char*)BatteryStatesText[BatteryState]));
00067 
00068         // Indicate that we're done
00069         curHTTP.callbackPos = 0x00;
00070         return;
00071 }
00072 
00073 //*******************************************************************************
00074 /**
00075 Performs Analogue to Digital (ADC) conversion on the selected port number.
00076 If it is for the battery it will disconnect the charger first so the voltage is read correctly
00077 
00078 \todo convert value into a voltage reading
00079 \todo Might have to delay reading abit to discharge any caps??
00080 
00081 @param  ADCPort, ACD port number
00082 @result WORD, outputs the value as a voltage
00083 */
00084 
00085 WORD FetchADC(int ADCPort) {
00086 
00087 
00088 
00089         WORD ADval;
00090 
00091     if (ADCPort == ADC_Battery) {
00092                 //ADCON3 Voltage on Battery
00093 
00094                 // Make sure the charger is disabled first
00095                 SLA_CHARGER_IO = 0;
00096                 // add delay here
00097 
00098                 // Select A/D channel
00099                 ADCON0 = 0b00001100;    // -> ADON = On(1), GO/DONE = Idle (0), AN3 selected (0011)
00100                 ADCON0bits.ADON = 1;
00101 
00102                  // AN0 should already be set up as an analog input
00103         ADCON0bits.GO = 1;
00104 
00105     // Wait until A/D conversion is done
00106     while(ADCON0bits.GO);
00107 
00108 
00109 
00110         }
00111 
00112         else if (ADCPort == ADC_Supply) {
00113                 //ADCON2 Voltage on Power supply
00114 
00115                 // Select A/D channel
00116                 ADCON0 = 0b00001000;    // -> ADON = On(1), GO/DONE = Idle (0), AN2 selected (0010)
00117                 ADCON0bits.ADON = 1;
00118 
00119                 // Wait until A/D conversion is done
00120             ADCON0bits.GO = 1;
00121             while(ADCON0bits.GO);
00122         }
00123 
00124 
00125         else {
00126                 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00127                         putsUART((ROM char*) '0' + ADCPort);
00128                         putrsUART((ROM char*)" <- There has been an error in the battery \\ power reading \r\n");
00129                 #endif
00130 
00131 }
00132   // Convert 10-bit value into ASCII string
00133   ADval = (WORD)ADRES;
00134   //ADval *= (WORD)10;
00135   //ADval /= (WORD)102;
00136 
00137 
00138 return ADval;
00139 
00140 }
00141 //******************************************************************************
00142 /// Task process for managing the battery state
00143 
00144 void BatteryTask(void) {
00145 
00146 BatteryStates PreviousState;
00147 
00148 // Chech the voltages
00149 SLA_CHARGER_IO = 0;
00150 VoltageBattery = FetchADC(ADC_Battery);
00151 VoltageSupply = FetchADC(ADC_Supply);
00152 
00153 PreviousState = BatteryState;
00154 
00155 // Check to see if we are running from battery
00156 if (SUPPLY_ACTIVE_IO == 0) {
00157         SLA_CHARGER_IO = 0; // make sure battery charger is off
00158         BatteryState = Battery_InUse;
00159         if (PreviousState != Battery_InUse)
00160                 addxPLMessage (TB_SendACStat);
00161         return;
00162 }
00163 
00164 
00165 if (VoltageBattery <= BATTERY_DISCONNECTED) BatteryState = Battery_Disconnected;
00166 else if (VoltageBattery >= BATTERY_LOW) BatteryState = Battery_Charged;
00167 else if (VoltageBattery <  BATTERY_LOW) {
00168         SLA_CHARGER_IO = 1;
00169         BatteryState = Battery_Charging;
00170 }
00171 
00172 // Send a state change message
00173 if (PreviousState != BatteryState) {
00174         if (PreviousState==Battery_InUse)
00175                 addxPLMessage (TB_SendACStat);
00176         else
00177                 addxPLMessage (TB_SendBatteryStat);
00178 }
00179 
00180 } //BatteryTask
00181 //******************************************************************************
